titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B73
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B73

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[... ...] (out) of [c]ut stone and square-cut stone and alabaster and decorated (stonework) [… ...] 2.[… ...] its plastering which is beside the elevated audience chamber, and they further repaired [… ...] 3.[… ...] as an [op]ening to an irrigation inlet(?), apart from its summit. And they carried out every command [… ...] 4.[… ...] which is beside a breach lock and he repaired it from its foundation to its summit and [… ...] 5.[… ...] in the year 669 (of the Ḥimyarite Era). And they further [repaired … ...] 6.[… ...] and Hinwam four upper outlets and four openings to irrigation inlets(?) [… ...] 7.[… ... fr]om its foundation and he built it up from its foundation. And they restored therein [… ...] 8.[… ...] its plain and three outlets as its upper portion. And they filled in (the interstices of) its small stones (with) persea-wood [... ...] 9.[… ...] the [la]nd of Ḥagūrum and the boundary of the ʿAkkum (tribe) and every command (to build) in polished stone and dark-colored hewn basalt [… ...].

out of cut stone and square-cut stone and alabaster and decorated stonework … ...
… ... its plastering which is beside the elevated audience chamber, and they further repaired … ...
… ... as an opening to an irrigation inlet?, apart from its summit. And they carried out every command … ...
… ... which is beside a breach lock and he repaired it from its foundation to its summit and … ...
… ... in the year
of the Ḥimyarite Era. And they further repaired … ...
… ... and Hinwam four upper outlets and four openings to irrigation inlets? … ...
… ... from its foundation and he built it up from its foundation. And they restored therein … ...
… ... its plain and three outlets as its upper portion. And they filled in the interstices of its small stones with persea-wood
… ... the land of Ḥagūrum and the boundary of the ʿAkkum tribe and every command to build in polished stone and dark-colored hewn basalt … ....
